deity.name: Arawai
deity.symbol: Sheaf of wheat tied with green ribbon {@i or} bronze dragon
entries: Arawai is the Sovereign of Life and Love. She is the patron of fertility and of the benevolent aspects of nature, bringing good harvest and gentle rain.

deity.name: Aureon
deity.symbol: Open tome {@i or} blue dragon
entries: Aureon is the Sovereign of Law and Lore. He is considered the first wizard, who shared the secrets of wizardry with the world.

deity.name: Balinor
deity.symbol: Pair of antlers {@i or} green dragon
entries: Balinor is the Sovereign of Horn and Hunt. He guides both the beast and the hunter, and he is the patron of those who walk on the edge of civilization and the natural world.

deity.name: Boldrei
deity.symbol: Fire in a stone hearth {@i or} copper dragon
entries: Boldrei is the Sovereign of Hall and Hearth. She guides and protects communities and families, inspiring people to work together for the common good.

deity.name: Cults of the Dragon Below
deity.symbol: Varies

deity.name: Dol Arrah
deity.symbol: Rising sun {@i or} red dragon
entries: Dol Arrah is the sun that drives away the darkness. She stands for wisdom in war and for those who fight with honor, pursue justice, and make sacrifices for the greater good.

deity.name: Dol Dorn
deity.symbol: Longsword crossed over a shield {@i or} silver dragon
entries: Dol Dorn is the Sovereign of Strength and Steel. He is the patron of the common soldier, and he guides the hands of anyone who holds a weapon. He embodies courage, strength, and martial skill.

deity.name: Kol Korran
deity.symbol: Nine-sided gold coin {@i or} white dragon
entries: Kol Korran is the Sovereign of World and Wealth. He guards travelers and guides traders. Although the Trickery domain is suggested for his clerics, Kol Korran guides fair negotiation; those driven solely by greed prefer the Keeper of the Dark Six.

deity.name: Olladra
deity.symbol: Domino {@i or} black dragon
entries: Olladra is the Sovereign of Feast and Fortune. She is the giver of joy and the granter of luck, patron to entertainers, gamblers, and anyone who takes a chance.

deity.name: Onatar
deity.symbol: Crossed hammer and tongs {@i or} brass dragon
entries: Onatar is the Sovereign of Fire and Forge. He guides both mundane smiths and artificers, inspiring anyone who performs an act of creation

deity.name: The Blood of Vol
deity.symbol: Red teardrop gem

deity.name: The Devourer
deity.symbol: Bundle of five sharpened bones {@i or} dragon turtle
entries: The Devourer governs the destructive power of nature, both pure elemental force and savagery in beasts.

deity.name: The Fury
deity.symbol: Winged wyrm with woman's head and arms
entries: The Fury governs both passion and revenge, rage and despair. She offers revenge to those who have been wronged, but her vengeance often leads to suffering.

deity.name: The Keeper
deity.symbol: Dragonshard in the shape of a fang {@i or} dracolich
entries: The Keeper snatches souls before they can reach Dolurrh and hoards them along with his vast wealth. Those driven by greed call him their patron, and his priests often act as criminal fixers.

deity.name: The Mockery
deity.symbol: Five blood-spattered blades {@i or} flayed dragon
entries: The Mockery is the patron of treachery and of terror in battle. He guides those who seek victory through guile, both warriors and assassins. He was once the brother of Dol Dorn and Dol Arrah, but he was stripped of his skin and his name after betraying them.

deity.name: The Path of Light
deity.symbol: Brilliant crystal

deity.name: The Shadow
deity.symbol: Obsidian tower
entries: The Shadow is the dark side of knowledge and ambition. It's said to be Aureon's shadow, given malign life when Aureon mastered magic. The Shadow is the maker of monsters and the keeper of forbidden secrets, and it offers malevolent spells to warlocks and wizards.

deity.name: The Silver Flame
deity.symbol: Flame drawn on silver or molded from silver

deity.name: The Spirits of the Past
deity.symbol: Varies

deity.name: The Traveler
deity.symbol: Four crossed, rune-inscribed bones
entries: The Traveler asserts that chaos drives evolution and that change makes us stronger. The Traveler is a trickster and the giver of dangerous gifts. Some artificers worship the Traveler, seeing it as the lord of innovation, but the gifts of the Traveler always have unexpected consequences.

deity.name: The Undying Court
deity.symbol: Golden mask
